member.name: T:OpenSSL.X509V3ExtensionList
member.summary: Dictionary for X509 v3 extensions - Name, Value

member.name: T:OpenSSL.ISequenceNumber
member.summary: Used for generating sequence numbers by the CertificateAuthority

member.name: M:OpenSSL.ISequenceNumber.Next
member.summary: Returns the next available sequence number

member.name: T:OpenSSL.FileSerialNumber
member.summary: Implements the ISequenceNumber interface. The sequence number is read from a file, incremented, then written back to the file

member.name: M:OpenSSL.FileSerialNumber.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Constructs a FileSerialNumber. The path specifies where the serial number should be read and written to.

member.name: M:OpenSSL.FileSerialNumber.Next
member.summary: Implements the Next() method of the ISequenceNumber interface. The sequence number is read from a file, incremented, then written back to the file

member.name: T:OpenSSL.SimpleSerialNumber
member.summary: Simple implementation of the ISequenceNumber interface.

member.name: M:OpenSSL.SimpleSerialNumber.#ctor
member.summary: Construct a SimpleSerialNumber with the initial sequence number set to 0.

member.name: M:OpenSSL.SimpleSerialNumber.#ctor(System.Int32)
member.summary: Construct a SimpleSerialNumber with the initial sequence number set to the value specified by the seed parameter.

member.name: M:OpenSSL.SimpleSerialNumber.Next
member.summary: Returns the next available sequence number. This implementation simply increments the current sequence number and returns it.

member.name: T:OpenSSL.X509CertificateAuthority
member.summary: High-level interface which does the job of a CA (Certificate Authority) Duties include processing incoming X509 requests and responding with signed X509 certificates, signed by this CA's private key.

member.name: M:OpenSSL.X509CertificateAuthority.SelfSigned(OpenSSL.Configuration,OpenSSL.ISequenceNumber,OpenSSL.X509Name,System.DateTime,System.TimeSpan)
member.summary: Factory method which creates a X509CertifiateAuthority where the internal certificate is self-signed

member.name: M:OpenSSL.X509CertificateAuthority.SelfSigned(OpenSSL.Configuration,OpenSSL.ISequenceNumber,OpenSSL.CryptoKey,OpenSSL.MessageDigest,OpenSSL.X509Name,System.DateTime,System.TimeSpan)
member.summary: Factory method that creates a X509CertificateAuthority instance with an internal self signed certificate

member.name: M:OpenSSL.X509CertificateAuthority.SelfSigned(OpenSSL.ISequenceNumber,OpenSSL.CryptoKey,OpenSSL.MessageDigest,OpenSSL.X509Name,System.DateTime,System.TimeSpan,OpenSSL.X509V3ExtensionList)
member.summary: Factory method that creates a X509CertificateAuthority instance with an internal self signed certificate. This method allows creation without the need for the Configuration file, X509V3Extensions may be added with the X509V3ExtensionList parameter

member.name: M:OpenSSL.X509CertificateAuthority.#ctor(OpenSSL.X509Certificate,OpenSSL.CryptoKey,OpenSSL.ISequenceNumber,OpenSSL.Configuration)
member.summary: Constructs a X509CertifcateAuthority with the specified parameters.

member.name: M:OpenSSL.X509CertificateAuthority.ProcessRequest(OpenSSL.X509Request,System.DateTime,System.DateTime)
member.summary: Process and X509Request. This includes creating a new X509Certificate and signing this certificate with this CA's private key.

member.name: M:OpenSSL.X509CertificateAuthority.ProcessRequest(OpenSSL.X509Request,System.DateTime,System.DateTime,OpenSSL.MessageDigest)
member.summary: Process and X509Request. This includes creating a new X509Certificate and signing this certificate with this CA's private key.

member.name: M:OpenSSL.X509CertificateAuthority.Dispose
member.summary: Dispose the key, certificate, and the configuration

member.name: P:OpenSSL.X509CertificateAuthority.Certificate
member.summary: Accessor to the CA's X509 Certificate

member.name: P:OpenSSL.X509CertificateAuthority.Key
member.summary: Accessor to the CA's key used for signing.

member.summary: Override to implement client/server specific handshake processing

member.name: T:OpenSSL.SslMethod
member.summary: Wraps the SSL_METHOD structure and methods

member.name: T:OpenSSL.Base
member.summary: Base class for all openssl wrapped objects. Contains the raw unmanaged pointer and has a Handle property to get access to it. Also overloads the ToString() method with a BIO print.

member.name: T:OpenSSL.IStackable
member.summary: Simple interface used for the internal implementation of the generic OpenSSL.Stack

member.name: M:OpenSSL.IStackable.Addref
member.summary: Adds to the reference count of the native object

member.name: P:OpenSSL.IStackable.IsOwner
member.summary: Owership property for the stackable item

member.name: F:OpenSSL.Base.owner
member.summary: If this object is the owner, then call the appropriate native free function.

member.name: F:OpenSSL.Base.isDisposed
member.summary: This is to prevent double-deletion issues.

member.name: M:OpenSSL.Base.#ctor(System.IntPtr,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Constructor which takes the raw unmanged pointer. This is the only way to construct this object and all dervied types.

member.name: M:OpenSSL.Base.Print(OpenSSL.BIO)
member.summary: This method is used by the ToString() implementation. A great number of openssl objects support printing, so this is a conveinence method. Dervied types should override this method and not ToString().
member.param: The BIO stream object to print into

member.name: M:OpenSSL.Base.ToString
member.summary: Override of ToString() which uses Print() into a BIO memory buffer.

member.name: M:OpenSSL.Base.Dispose
member.summary: Implementation of the IDisposable interface. If the native pointer is not null, we haven't been disposed, and we are the owner, then call the virtual OnDispose() method.

member.name: P:OpenSSL.Base.IsOwner
member.summary: gets/sets whether the object owns the Native pointer

member.name: P:OpenSSL.Base.Handle
member.summary: Access to the raw unmanaged pointer. Implements the IStackable interface.

member.summary: Factory method that calls XXX() to deserialize a DH object from a DER-formatted buffer using the BIO interface.

member.summary: Calls ASN1_i2d_bio() with the i2d = i2d_DHparams().

member.name: P:OpenSSL.DH.PEM
member.summary: Creates a BIO.MemoryBuffer(), calls WriteParametersPEM() into this buffer, then returns the buffer as a string.

member.summary: Creates a BIO.MemoryBuffer(), calls WriteParametersDER() into this buffer, then returns the buffer.

member.summary: Sets or clears the FlagNoExpConstTime bit in the flags field.

member.name: T:OpenSSL.DH.CheckCode
member.summary: Flags for the return value of DH_check().

member.returns: Int32 representation of options set in the context

member.summary: Calls X509_STORE_new() and then adds the specified chaing as trusted.

member.name: T:OpenSSL.SslContext
member.summary: Wraps the SST_CTX structure and methods

member.name: M:OpenSSL.SslContext.SetCertificateStore(OpenSSL.X509Store)
member.summary: Sets the certificate store for the context - calls SSL_CTX_set_cert_store The X509Store object and contents will be freed when the context is disposed. Ensure that the store object and it's contents have IsOwner set to false before assigning them into the context.

member.name: M:OpenSSL.SslContext.SetVerify(OpenSSL.VerifyMode,OpenSSL.RemoteCertificateValidationCallback)
member.summary: Sets the certificate verification mode and callback - calls SSL_CTX_set_verify

member.name: M:OpenSSL.SslContext.SetVerifyDepth(System.Int32)
member.summary: Sets the certificate verification depth - calls SSL_CTX_set_verify_depth

member.name: P:OpenSSL.SslContext.CAList
member.summary: Calls SSL_CTX_set_client_CA_list/SSL_CTX_get_client_CA_list The Stack and the X509Name objects contined within them are freed when the context is disposed. Make sure that the Stack and X509Name objects have set IsOwner to false before assigning them to the context.

member.name: T:OpenSSL.OpenSslError
member.summary: This is a struct that contains a uint for the native openssl error code. It provides helper methods to convert this error code into strings.

member.name: T:OpenSSL.OpenSslException
member.summary: Exception class to provide OpenSSL specific information when errors occur.

member.name: M:OpenSSL.OpenSslException.#ctor
member.summary: When this class is instantiated, GetErrorMessage() is called automatically. This will call ERR_get_error() on the native openssl interface, once for every error that is in the current context. The exception message is the concatination of each of these errors turned into strings using ERR_error_string_n().

member.name: P:OpenSSL.OpenSslException.Errors
member.summary: Returns the list of errors associated with this exception.
